column4: hey guys, how do you install kde, on ubuntu, is there a kde-install-all package in the spm?
kubuntu-desktop is what you need to install
it is envyng-gtk for gnome (-qt for kde)
I can find envy in spm under any name!
does restricted drivers manager do a better job than envy or the same?
envy in gutsy is not supported here
restricted drivers manager, will it install nvidia 8500 gt so it will be utilized fully?
it should do; dont have that card so cannot say from personal experience
how do I use the tv out on the card, does rdm install a utility to do this?
they are not meant to be used together
no means of comparing here as I only use the one.
no, but there is a workaround if you wish
